channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dog fouling around public fields, 26th September
item.description:
I regularly walk my dog around the fields shown in the attached screenshot, and unfortunately there is an increasing problem with dog mess along this route. I now have to watch my step constantly. In addition, some people are bagging their dog waste but then leaving the bags in hedges rather than using a bin. I’ve marked with an “X” on the map where this is happening most often. I’m not sure what can be done, but it is spoiling the area for everyone. Perhaps some polite reminder signs encouraging responsible behaviour, along with directions to the nearest dog waste bin, could help improve things. Thank you for looking into this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Larimar Close, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 26th September
item.description:
Customer states that a nearby developer has recently installed trees and large rocks on this verge, which has completed removed the visibility splays for vehicles leaving the Archery Club onto the main road. Asking if these are allowed to be here and if they can be removed.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree branch ready to fall onto road, 26th September
item.description:
There is a damaged tree branch which will fall onto the road soon. This has the potential to cause a serious car incident. Why don’t you just cut this branch and remove it before it does? Especially now there is a temporary traffic light near by.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: I have asked Cheltenham Borough Council several times for an annual street clean & been told this is delayed due to availability of GCC contractors & lack of resources, response., 26th September
item.description:
Large amounts of rubbish & debris in the road & pavements both sides of the road. Blocked & heavily littered curbs, covering & blocked drains. Trees significantly overgrown & need pollarding. This throughout Alstone Avenue & previous twice yearly street clean has stopped
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Alstone Avenue, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
